bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 44 (Thursday, March 5, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KING of Iowa:H.R. 6095.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 7[Page H1536]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

summary.text: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 214 Jackson Street in Sioux City, Iowa, as the "General George 'Bud' Day Post Office Building."

bill.title: Brigadier General George Bud Day, the Most Decorated Veteran in American History Next to General Douglas MacArthur, Act

item.title: Brigadier General George Bud Day, the Most Decorated Veteran in American History Next to General Douglas MacArthur, Act
To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 214 Jackson Street in Sioux City, Iowa, as the "General George 'Bud' Day Post Office Building".
Brigadier General George Bud Day, the Most Decorated Veteran in American History Next to General Douglas MacArthur, Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
